title: Foundry Journal Typeface
content:
Does anyone know where I can purchase this typeface online?  
Greatly appreciated.  
A.
author: zagatka2

comments.content: this is actually a different typeface... it comes from a British foundry... I emailed them but who knows how long it'll take to hear back... thanks though

Hello,

As far as I am aware the Foundry’s typefaces are only available through the company itself. But nothing to worry about, they are very helpful and efficient and will certainly come back to you soon.
Helpful and efficient? I hear otherwise, Paul. Have you ordered from them before?

If I'm not mistaken, Foundry Journal is a reworking by designer David Quay of his earlier typeface, Quay Sans. The latter face is readily available from several sources/foundries, including:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/quay-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194048/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/quay-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/quay-sans/")  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufac...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141006194048/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=ITC.108281.0.0 "http://www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=ITC.108281.0.0")
I'll keep my fingers crossed they get back to me soon. "Foundry Journal" is what we're looking for, exactly that, nothing more, nothing less.
According to their site it's all available through them but I've never ordered there.

I enquired via their web form about pricing on Monoline today, and got a very full and helpful reply within three hours from Freda.

A full price list was appended, the Journal family (via email, single-seat) is £225.00 for Mac, and £250.00 for PC, plus VAT (I suppose for UK customers only?), CD £10.00 extra.

It seems pretty straight forward.

Richard
